qas.question: What has been funded as part of the education initiatives

answers.text: As part of its education-related initiatives, the foundation has funded journalists, think tanks, lobbying organizations and governments

qas.question: what do the millions in grants given to news agencies do

answers.text: Millions of dollars of grants to news organizations have funded reporting on education and higher education

qas.question: Critics don't like the foundations use of media why

answers.text: critics have feared the foundation for directing the conversation on education or pushing its point of view through news coverage

qas.question: Where does the foundation list grants

answers.text: the foundation has said it lists all its grants publicly
Teach Plus, which was founded by new teachers and advocates against seniority-based layoffs

plausible_answers.text: for directing the conversation on education or pushing its point of view through news coverage

qas.question: Who founded the Education Writers Association?

context: <a0_0>As part of its education-related initiatives, the foundation has funded <b7_0>journalists, think tanks, lobbying organizations and governments<b7_0/><a0_0/>. <a1_0>Millions of dollars of grants to news organizations have funded reporting on education and higher education<a1_0/>, including more than $1.4 million to the Education Writers Association to fund training for journalists who cover education. While some <a2_0>critics have feared the foundation <b6_0>for directing the conversation on education or pushing its point of view through news coverage<b6_0/><a2_0/>, <a3_0><b8_0>the foundation has said it lists all its grants publicly<b8_0/><a3_0/> and does not enforce any rules for content among its grantees, who have editorial independence. Union activists in Chicago have accused Gates Foundation grantee <a4_0>Teach Plus, which was founded by <b9_0>new teachers and advocates against seniority-based layoffs<b9_0/><a4_0/>, of "<b5_0>astroturfing<b5_0/>".
